name: GBSL- WTT Replacement
description: This project aims to replace an existing app (WTT), that allows bids & tenders team to better manage and communicate the tenders received from high priority customers.
scope: The aim is to create a web app that allows the bids and tenders team within the commercial lines department to receive the request from the customers, change the format to CMA working file, dispatch it to trades, receive the prices from trades, consolidate all the prices in one file, convert it back to customer format and go through different rounds until bid is awarded or not.
goals: minimize mistakes that can cost a lot
high customer satisfaction due to fast response and interaction
risks: File formatting ( customer to CMA and vice versa)
Dispatch the bids to their respective trade lines

name: Container Sales Platform Report
description: The project aims to sell used containers online and directly to CMA CGM Customers. It will provide a centralized tool for all sales agents worldwide and HO logistics team to sell and manage containers existing in all depots in every country.
scope: A webApp will be developed by Beirut Hub team that will allow clients to purchase containers, Agents to manage all containers info in the depots and Admins to monitor the platform and sales worldwide.
goals: Digitalized tool to sell used containers
Increase in sales of used containers.
risks: The project missed a Front-end developer for multiple sprints
roi: $1.4 M Increase in revenue within the next 2 years

name: Empty Container Projection Report
description: The project aims at Streamlining the weekly container projection forecast collection process from 14 agencies (115 locations) for 4 forecasted weeks (current + next 3 weeks) and file consolidation by ARO Logistics​. It will Provide a centralized tool for ARO logistics and HO logistics team to perform container stock reposition planning to minimize imbalance and finalized supply plans for each location. Distribute supply plans to agencies, track historical data and reporting efficiently.
scope: Develop a centralized tool will be developed that allowing both ARO and HO logistics teams to plan container stock repositioning. This minimizes imbalances and solidifies supply plans for all locations.
goals: Optimize the weekly container forecast collection and consolidation process
Enhance accuracy, and productivity by reducing manual efforts
risks: The project missed a Front-end developer for 2 sprints (4 weeks) due to an emergency medical case and is behind schedule
Mitigation Plan: Strengthen the front-end development team by reallocating resources and assigning additional developers to catch up on the backlog and get back on schedule.
roi: Saving of 123 man- days/year (61500 USD) by reducing manual efforts spent by ARO Logistics and HO Logistics teams
